goals.question: What is the distribution of population by age group?
goals.visualization: Bar chart of population by age group
goals.rationale: This visualization helps to understand the age distribution of the population and identify any age groups that may require special attention or resources.

goals.question: What is the trend of population growth over time?
goals.visualization: Line chart of population over time
goals.rationale: This visualization helps to identify any trends in population growth over time and can be used to forecast future population growth.

goals.question: What is the distribution of population by gender?
goals.visualization: Pie chart of population by gender
goals.rationale: This visualization helps to understand the gender distribution of the population and identify any gender disparities that may require attention.

goals.question: What is the distribution of population by region?
goals.rationale: This visualization helps to understand the geographic distribution of the population and identify any regions that may require special attention or resources.

goals.question: What is the distribution of population by education level?
goals.visualization: Stacked bar chart of population by education level
goals.rationale: This visualization helps to understand the education level distribution of the population and identify any education level disparities that may require attention.

code:
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    age_groups = data['age_group'].unique()
    population = [data[data['age_group'] == age]['population'].sum() for age in age_groups]
    
    plt.bar(age_groups, population)
    plt.xlabel('Age Group')
    plt.ylabel('Population')
    plt.title('What is the distribution of population by age group?')
    
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    
    data['date'] = pd.to_datetime(data['date'], errors='ignore')
    data = data.sort_values(by='date')
    
    plt.plot(data['date'], data['population'])
    
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    plt.title("What is the trend of population growth over time?", wrap=True)
    
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    gender_counts = data['gender'].value_counts()
    plt.pie(gender_counts, labels=gender_counts.index, autopct='%1.1f%%')
    plt.title("What is the distribution of population by gender?", wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker
import geopandas as gpd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    gdf = gpd.GeoDataFrame(data, geometry=gpd.points_from_xy(data.longitude, data.latitude))
    world = gpd.read_file(gpd.datasets.get_path('naturalearth_lowres'))
    ax = world.plot(color='white', edgecolor='black', figsize=(6, 6))
    gdf.plot(ax=ax, column='population', legend=True, cmap='viridis', markersize=5)
    plt.title("What is the distribution of population by region?", wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    
    data.groupby(['education_level', 'year'])['population'].sum().unstack().plot(kind='bar', stacked=True)
    
    plt.title("What is the distribution of population by education level?")
    plt.xlabel("Education Level")
    plt.ylabel("Population")
    
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()
